Case reference: 2013000094.CaseDesc: Robert Beauchamp was last seen in Montreal on June 22, 1993. He left his home with friends and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2006023799.CaseDesc: On July 12, 1999, Jerzy Ryglewicz was last seen at a gas station in Merrickville. He has not been seen or made contact with any friends or family since.

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2018059603.CaseDesc:
After new information has been brought forward, investigators believe Lisa MACEACHERN was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta leaving a business located in the 800 block of First Street S.W., on Wednesday, June 27, 2018. Lisa is also believed to have been staying at a residence in the 1000 block of First Street S.W., prior to her disappearance. 

There are no footprints of life following Lisa’s last known phone contact with her family, which occurred on Tuesday, July 3, 2018. She has not been heard from since. 

It is uncharacteristic for Lisa’s family to have no contact with her, and they continue to be concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022012676.CaseDesc: Sum Yee Li was last seen leaving her home in East Gwillimbury, Ontario on December 26, 2021. This is out of character for her, as she used to check in on her son on a frequent basis. She has been known to travel internationally and to Western Canada. It is believed that she was the victim of foul play due to the length of time she has been missing.

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William Morgan was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, he was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of William.

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, Quebec, mentioning that she was going to an appointment. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014005227.CaseDesc: Carl Chenier was last seen in Montreal on February 23, 2009 by the superintendent of his apartment. It is believed that he may have mental health problems, but he was not on any medications. He often used the Montreal Metro.

Case reference: 2023064026.CaseDesc: Leah Keeper was last seen on July 25, 2023, on Selkirk Avenue in Winnipeg, Manitoba. She has not been in contact with her two children, which is out of the ordinary. Leah has not been seen or heard from since that date.

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2024020668.CaseDesc: Yeghia Meymarian was seen on April 21, 2024, entering the water ways near Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, NY.  At that time Yeghia was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2008, Laventus Burke was seen for the last time in St. Albans, Newfoundland and Labrador. During the time of his disappearance, Laventus had left a note for his mother indicating that he was going to travel to Alberta for work, and then would be moving to the State of Florida in the United States.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, Saskatchewan. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000050.CaseDesc: William 'Billy' Weinbender has been missing since approximately 7:30pm on May 6th, 1994 from Winnipeg. At the time he went missing he was living in an apartment building in the North End of the city. William "Billy" was last seen in the McPhillips Street and Leila Avenue area of Winnipeg.

Case reference: 2006023399.CaseDesc: John Allen Bowes was last seen in Nipigon, Ontario getting gasoline on August 15, 1992. He was travelling eastbound toward his home in Kingston, Ontario. Mr. Bowes usually wears a baseball cap.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2017034100.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2017, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Olumide Arigbede was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006470.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2001, Shahzad Ahmed was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Shahzad last contacted his mother by telephone to tell her that he had been fired from his job. During the course of their conversation, his mother had told him to return home to her apartment in Toronto, but he never arrived. The next telephone call that Shahzad’s mother received was from the Islamabad police in Pakistan, who had informed her that Shahzad’s luggage had been found unclaimed on the airport luggage carousel.

Case reference: 2014005741.CaseDesc: Joseph Angus Morin had been living in Sturgeon Landing, Saskatchewan but left in December 2011, to take up residence in Wanless, MB. Joseph frequently traveled between the communities in the immediate area and was last seen in Cranberry Portage on or about January 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2006011599.CaseDesc: Ervin Bollom was last seen on Obonga Lake, 30 km south of Armstrong, on October 9, 1974.  He had left in his boat to get medical help for an injured friend. His boat was found with the throttle in the "open" position.

Ring: Left Ring Finger, wedding ring - E.B. engraved on the inside
Tattoo: Left Arm, red rose with green stem and the text "true love"

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2012002099.CaseDesc: Kelly Coleman was last seen near Mac's Convenience on Mapleview Drive in Barrie, Ontario in August 2011.  Kelly suffers from health-related issues and has not had contact with her family or friends since January 3, 2012. They are concerned for her well-being and are requesting assistance from anyone who may have had any contact with her.

Case reference: 2012020057.CaseDesc: Peter Halcrow was last seen on March 14, 1994 walking in the "Sawmill" area between 14:00hrs and 15:00hrs.  Peter has not been seen since.

Shoes: Leather, Green, White, Reebok with purple

Case reference: 2014005384.CaseDesc: Gary Humphrey left his home and employment in Oshawa, Ontario, on 1 April 1989, to visit family in Northern Ireland.  Gary returned to Canada via the Thunder Bay Airport in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003009.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1979, Adolphe Thorassie and three hunting partners were attempting to return home after a successful hunt. Two men were in each boat. On the return trip the men had to go to shore once to get out of the winds. They again departed despite the high winds on the lake which was causing the water to be extremely dangerous with high waves. Adolphe was in the lead boat with his hunting partner, and unbeknownst to him the second boat had to return to shore for motor repairs. Adolphe and his hunting partner never returned and were reported missing the next day. The body of Adolphe's hunting partner was discovered and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. It is assumed Mr. Thorassie also drowned.

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021, Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2023031497.CaseDesc: On 2022-06-02, Michael Vanrookhuyzen was last seen in Chaplin, Saskatchewan where he had mentioned that he was going to see a friend in Toronto, Ontario.  Michael has not been seen or heard from his family or friends in over a year. Michael suffers from paranoid schizophrenia.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2014001248.CaseDesc: William Roy Tennant left his home in the Municipality of Leamington, Ontario, on October 5, 1990. William was reported missing on October 9th, 1990, by his sister, who was concerned about his mental health.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2022049575.CaseDesc: On September 30,2022, Lawrence Bertrim was last seen on foot in the downtown core of Smiths Falls, Ontario. It is believed that he was met with foul play.

Jewelry: Other, Rings, Text "If you don't like it go f**k yourself"
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Chinese symbol of the birth year

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers
Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and disappeared without notice.

Case reference: 2012020066.CaseDesc: On October 22, 1988, in the early evening Betsy Owens was playing volleyball at the local school in Pauingassi, Manitoba. At approximately 11:00 pm, Betsy left the school with her boyfriend, returning to his residence. Betsy was last seen by her boyfriend the following morning when she left his home. Despite several searches, Betsy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2014004091.CaseDesc: Mark Gibbons was seen for the last time on February 1, 1991 at his home in Calgary, Alberta.  He was reported missing by his family and Mark has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023036470.CaseDesc: Ryan Liu was last seen by his brother on July 9, 2023 as he left the family residence in Richmond, British Columbia.  On the same night, Ryan was also captured on video in West Vancouver, British Columbia.  Ryan has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Cream, Ivory, T Shirt, Large logo on the front

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2023001519.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2023, Krystal Russell was reported missing. The last footprint of life for Krystal Russell is December 31, 2022.

Case reference: 2014002498.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1995, Calahan Vandermint was reported missing by his girlfriend when she received a concerning letter from him. Calahan Vandermint was staying at the East Glen Motor Inn in Edmonton, Alberta. He was last seen riding his bike away from the motel on June 6, 1995.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014001747.CaseDesc: On July 1, 1978, Brenda Bidner was seen for the last time in the Saint-Laurent District in Montreal, Quebec. She was known to travel frequently between Montreal and New York, in the United States. Brenda has not been seen and her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2014005716.CaseDesc: Maria MARIN left her personal belongings at Johnsons Lake near Wasa, British Columbia and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2022061830.CaseDesc: Ashley Shingoose was last seen on March 11, 2022 in Winnipeg, Manitoba.  She has not been seen or heard from since. Ashley led a high-risk lifestyle and was frequently seen by various agencies within Winnipeg, including shelters and various hospitals.

Case reference: 2014005263.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2007, Annie Proulx was seen for the last time in the Rimouski area in Quebec. Annie has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Rose, Heart and Bulldog

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India and was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2020050890.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2020, days after the death of her son, Audrey Beaver was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. That day, Audrey had told her family that she planned on setting up a tent to live in.

Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2010003099.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2010, OPP received a report that support cheques for Shelley Anderson of Cobalt Ontario, were returned uncashed for the past 12 months. Police attempted to locate her but were unsuccessful. She was last seen in the Haileybury and Cobalt area some time during the summer of 2009. Ms. Anderson also has ties to the Timmins and Schumacher areas, as she lived there for most of her life.

Case reference: 2012020659.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2012, at approximately 1:30 a.m., Brandy Wesadquate was seen for the last time leaving a house party in the 900 block of Rae Street in Regina, Saskatchewan. Since then, Brandy has not had any contact with her family or friends.

Jacket: White, Black, Zippered; Adidas brand, blue or black stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2014002901.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1981, Carlos Yuste was residing with friends in Thompson, Manitoba. He departed the residence and never returned. Carlos left behind all his clothing and personal belongings. He was described by his friends as being very depressed due to his unemployment. Mr. Yuste has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Aliases: GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel
YUSTE GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2022053668.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2022, Brett William Moore was reported missing in Kelowna, British Columbia. Brett was living a transient lifestyle and family has not seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014006562.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2014, Kamalanathan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Markham, Ontario. His backpack, which contained all of his personal effects and his identification, was found near the Horseshoe Falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005431.CaseDesc: Mahendiran Ratnasingam last spoke with his ex-wife on June 8th, 2006, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000120.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2002, Lisa Marie Young was seen for the last time in Nanaimo, British Columba. On the night of June 29, Lisa travelled to a local bar, and met with some acquaintances. Lisa and her acquaintances accepted a ride from a man to an afterparty. Subsequently, Lisa left with this male driver to get some food, but communicated to her acquaintances that she would be returning to them via taxi. She has not been seen or heard from since. Based on investigational information, the Nanaimo RCMP Serious Crime Unit believes that she may have been met with foul play. Police request that anyone with information contact them directly.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Hoop necklace with medallion
Tattoo: Right Arm, Band of flowers with heart

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2022065035.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2022, Alex Lawson was last seen on foot, leaving his Madeline Street apartment in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Family have not heard from Alex since he was reported missing and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Blue, WINTER, Two tone puffy northface jacket
Scar: Abdomen, 8" wide from lower chest to pubic hair

Case reference: 2014006004.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2013, Timmothy Benedict-Leaf was last seen at his family residence in Akwesasne, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2014001622.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 1982, Clayton Mark Bussiere was last seen while driving his taxi cab on Lougheed Highway (Highway 7) in Mission, British Columbia. Mr. Bussiere's taxi cab, a 1978 blue Pontiac Lemans, has never been located. It is unclear as to whether or not Mr. Bussiere had a passenger at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Saint Christopher Medal necklace
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace up shoes; brand: Downunders
Sweater: Grey, Zippered Cardigan with Elbow Patches

Case reference: 2014004588.CaseDesc: On November 23, 1986, Pierre-Jean Durocher was last seen. He was reported missing on November 25, 1986, by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. Durocher lived in a rooming house in Longueuil. His backpack containing his identification was found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge in Montreal.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 2009004199.CaseDesc: Manou Sokpor was reported missing to police by his fiancée. She had last spoken with Manou at 2:00 a.m. on May 14th, 2009 by telephone; nothing seemed out of the ordinary. His fiancée had no further contact with Manou the rest of that day which was out of his character. On May 15th the vehicle Manou usually drove was located in his driveway, and his wallet and cellular phone were in the bedroom.

Teeth: Visible Missing, First or second molar upper left jaw, gap in front teeth.

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2014005112.CaseDesc: Tian You Li left his extended family home in East Vancouver to go for his routine walk. He never returned. He suffers from Alzheimers and may be confused and disorientated.

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.
